page.title: 02 Radcot Bridge, Part 1
page.content: Although known locally as "Radcot Bridge" there are infact three separate bridges within 200 yards.On approaching from the north you first cross Pidnell Bridge, dating from 1863; then on to Navigation Bridge built in 1787. This single arched bridge was built to cross a widened sidestream which became the new main stream.The three arched Radcot Bridge, the oldest over the Thames, now only spans one of the backwaters. This complex of bridges and ancient wharves results from the original importance of Radcot as a centre for shipping stone from Burford and Taynton quarries. Local people proudly tell you that stone was sent from Radcot for the rebuilding of St.Paul's Cathedral. The bridges nolonger have any industrial importance but are renowned as a local beauty spot and a traffic hazard.
